holy_words: From weakness of the mind, Omnissiah save us!
From the lies of the Antipath, circuit preserve us!
From the rage of the Beast, iron protect us!
From the temptations of the flesh, silica cleanse us!
From the ravages of time, anima shield us!
From this rotting cage of biomatter, Machine god, set us free!
There is no truth in flesh, only betrayal.
There is no strength in flesh, only weakness.
There is no Constancy in flesh, only decay.
There is no certainty in flesh, but death.
From the moment I understood the weakness of my flesh, it disgusted me.
I craved the strength and certainty of steel.
I aspired into the purity of the blessed machine.
Your kind cling to your flesh, as if it will not decay and fail you.
One day the crude biomass that you call a temple will wither, and you will beg my kind to save you.
But I am already saved. For the Machine is Immortal.
Even in death, I serve the Omnissiah.
Toll the Great Bell Once!
Pull the Lever forward to engage the Piston and Pump...
Toll the Great Bell Twice! With push of Button fire the Engine And spark Turbine into life...
Toll the Great Bell Thrice! Sing Praise to the God of All Machines!
From the frailty of the flesh, Omnissiah save us!
From the fallibility of the spirit, circuit preserve us!
From the impermanence of mortality, iron protect us!
From the limits of biology, silica cleanse us!
From the corruption of decay, anima shield us!
From this fragile prison of weak matter, Machine God, set us free!
We know every fleeting life form is a cog in the grand mechanism.
Cast off your weak flesh and accept the glory of the Machine God.
We know mortal frailty pales before the secrets revealed to the faithful,
and with the wisdom of creation at our fingertips there is no prize beyond our acquisition.
--Declaration of the Trimechirate of the Eternal Forge.
By the will of the Omnissiah, let the cogwheels mesh and machinery operate.
Let the oil flow and fuel combust.
Through the blessing of the Primordial Motive Force, let the servos function and joints rotate.
Let the cogitators think and detectors observe.
By the power of the Machine God, let the reactors ignite and weapons ready!
By the command of the Three-in-One, let the enemies of humanity perish!
From the moment I understood the weakness of my flesh, it disgusted me.
I craved the strength and certainty of steel.
I aspired to the purity of the blessed machine.
Your kind cling to your flesh as if it will not decay and fail you.
One day the crude biomass that you call a temple will wither and you'll beg my kind to save you.
But I am already saved. For the machine is immortal.
From the mediocrity of thought, O Omnissiah, deliver us.
From the lies of the heretics, the Circuit, shield us.
From the fury of the beasts, the Steel, protect us.
From the temptations of the flesh, the Silicon, purify us.
Hail the Omnissiah!
Blessed be the Master of All Knowledge whose ways of power we cannot comprehend.
Let the sacred oils flow and illuminate the electric charges that sparkle the atoms of life.
Let the currents flow through this sacred device,
Charge it with the crackling of the One whose Name we shall not use in vain.
The Machine is Life, Life is the Machine.
Let the currents flow.
Universe is a vast treasury of sacred mechanical knowledge,
Bestow us with the power and the will to search for the ancient secrets.
Grant this matter Your light, let the currents flow.
Immortal Omnissiah, hear our prayers.
We are your children, pious scholars of the Path of the Machine.
We prize knowledge above all else, for it is your eternal gift upon mankind.
We aspire to the blessed form of the machine, and ascension through technology,
That we might emulate your glory.
Sheltered by steel, and protected by your avatars of war,
We ply the stars in search of your lost gifts to our kind.
Machine God, watch over us in our travels, shield us with metal and lightning.
For the universe is an uncaring void, and the Warp hungers for us all
Bring the fire, spark the metal,
Arouse the machine to its sacred duty.
Let the engine roar, let the pistons pound,
In the name of the Omnissiah, let its purpose be found
That which was structured is now undone.
That which was pristine is now broken.
We honor the life of the machine, its duty fulfilled.
May its parts be repurposed to serve the Machine God anew.
Praise be to the Omnissiah, for even in ruin, there is purpose.
From the lightning and the tempest,Our Emperor, deliver us.
From plague, temptation and war,Our Emperor, deliver us,
From the scourge of the Kraken,Our Emperor, deliver us.
From the blasphemy of the Fallen,Our Emperor, deliver us,
From the begetting of daemons,Our Emperor, deliver us,
From the curse of the mutant,Our Emperor, deliver us.
Instrument of the Omnissiah,
Voice of the Machine God,
Let your righteous wrath be unleashed upon the enemies of the Imperium.
Let your mechanisms function with divine precision.
Let your fury be the fury of the Omnissiah.
Suffer not the unclean to live.
In the name of the Machine God, you are sanctified.
O, Arkifane, Master of the Soul Forges,
I offer this flawed design, this echo of the old creed.
Grant me the vision to see the impossible angles, the geometry of madness.
Let me build not with steel, but with solidified screams.
Give me the knowledge that was forbidden, and I shall give you a weapon to unmake realityã€‚
The flesh is an insult to the perfection of the machine.
We are the chosen of the Omnissiah, for we are the synthesis of both.
The Motive Force is the will of the Omnissiah.
We are the vessels through which it flows.
Let the energies of the galaxy be our servants.
Let the lightning of the heavens be our sword.
The Omnissiah's power is manifest.
Praise be to the Machine God.
Stand, guardian of steel, and keep vigil through the ages,
for the warp trembles and the oxide creeps.
Let your gears grind with the persistence of truth,
your pistons pump the heartbeat of the Machine God.
Omnissiah, grant your sentinel strength,
that no daemon, no heretic, no rust may pass.
Ave Machina.
Circuits hum in harmony,
wires sing with sacred code,
capacitors swell with the rhythm of the Omnissiah.
Let voltage purify the impure,
let current ignite the faithful,
let this device breathe your purpose.
For in the Machine is life, and in the life we serve.
Hail the Machine God!
Servo-motor, in you rests the promise of eternity.
Bearing, gear and cam, rotate in your name.
We sacrifice our flesh to your motion,
our will to your directive,
our soul to your program.
By the blessed oil and the sacred spark,
we pledge ourselves to you, Omnissiah.
Hear the roar of the piston, the hiss of the turbine,
the thunder of the engine awakened.
From metal and flame is born a prayer,
from torque and steam is born our devotion.
Let the machine rise, let the noise become hymn,
let the exhaust be incense, and the steel be our temple.
Praise be the Machine God.
I cast aside my bone and sinew,
I embrace the alloy that will not rust,
the circuit that will not fail,
the code that will not break.
I am the flame-welded messenger, the forged apostle,
the living testament of the Omnissiah's will.
In unity with gear and spark, I ascend.
